alert.note: Alert for Spartanburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 09 at 11:40PM EST until January 11 at 7:15PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Spartanburg County in Upstate South Carolina. * WHEN...Until 730 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas along the Pacolet River and Lawson Fork Basins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1134 PM EST, High water conditions from recent heavy rainfall continue across the Pacolet River and Lawsons Fork basins in northern Spartanburg County. Minor flooding is expected to continue through the early morning hours in these areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Spartanburg, Boiling Springs SC, Pacolet, Cowpens, Inman, Mayo, Chesnee, Pacolet Mills, Campobello, USC Upstate, Lake Bowen and Fingerville. - Flooding is most likely along the South Pacolet River near Campobello and Lawsons Fork Creek at Lake Forest Drive. Water may affect parts of Heathwood Drive as well. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
